title: Why Polaris Prize nominee Elisapie loved Dany Laferrière's L'Énigme du retour | CBC Books
text:
Quebec artist Elisapie is nominated for the 2019 Polaris Prize for the album The Ballad of the Runaway Girl. Recorded after a six-year hiatus, the striking album is a mix of original material and covers of formative Indigenous rock and folk songs, sung in Inuktitut, English and French.

The 2019 Polaris Prize winner will be announced on Sept. 16, 2019. The $50,000 award is annually given to the best full-length Canadian album.

CBC Books asked Elisapie to recommend a book that is meaningful to her. She chose L'Énigme du retour by Dany Laferrière.

"I related to his story of exile. For me, who left her home to a whole new world taking in the solitude and seeing beauty and poetry everywhere in new discoveries.

"I cried and I laughed. A whole new vision of Quebec. I related to it being on the road, trying to find a new home and comfort."

Elisapie's comments have been edited for length and clarity.
